definition: lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/store
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
day/sky/heaven
lid/top/cover/canopy/to cover/to conceal/to build
surname Ge
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Registers the Internet, the related news blots out the sky with "the black screen".
sentences.chinese: 登录互联网，与“黑屏”有关的消息铺天盖地。

sentences.english: In the street corner also presented the treatment sterile sterile adlet which blots out the sky.
sentences.chinese: 街头上也出现了铺天盖地的治疗不孕不育的小广告。

sentences.english: To deliver a powerful message pointlessly is the result of weak creative content.
sentences.chinese: 铺天盖地的无意义信息是创造力贫乏的结果。

sentences.english: We should never allow ourselves to be burdened by opportunities that abound.
sentences.chinese: 我们不应让自己被铺天盖地的机会所困扰。

sentences.english: Ah, the time of year when political news is everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 啊，又到了一年中政治新闻铺天盖地的时节了。

sentences.english: But success is measured in so much more than just scantron bubbles and fill-in-the-blank questions.
sentences.chinese: 但是，衡量成功的标准却是铺天盖地的选择填空题。

sentences.english: Royal weddings always did constitute big news story status, of course, but your average blueblood marrying someone not too far from a second cousin twice removed has nothing on this.
sentences.chinese: 皇室婚礼免不了铺天盖地的新闻渲染，但是？

sentences.english: We face this sea of advice all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是面对这样铺天盖地的忠告。

sentences.english: I wanted to know why green is so overwhelmingly popular in my house.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道为什么我的房子里都是铺天盖地的绿色。

sentences.english: Fishes blots out the sky and the land, dancing around Trapp and the accordion vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 铺天盖地的鱼，从天上游下来，围着手风琴。

sentences.english: We reverse the pervasive trend towards stock-based incentive compensation.
sentences.chinese: 我们要逆转铺天盖地的股权激励潮。

definition: to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
lit. to fill the whole sky and cover the land; everywhere/as far as the eye can see
lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering/fig. gigantic/of spectacular significance
to rush around everywhere/always active
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
(of snow etc) to fill the sky
lit. to fill the whole sky and cover the land; everywhere/as far as the eye can see
in unbroken succession (idiom)
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
in all directions/all around/far and near
to be full of/to flood/to congest
to bomb indiscriminately
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to sweep along/to coerce
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
